30.title: Opioid Crisis In America - What is Going On?
30.intro: There is a legitimate epidemic of opioid abuse sweeping through the cities and towns of the United States. Why is this happening, and what might we do about it?

29.title: The End of Jobs - Robots and AI are Taking All Our Jobs
29.intro: Low skilled and medium skilled labor jobs are on the decline as automation and robotics are replacing humans at an accelerating rate worldwide. The old way of doing things is either going away or is already gone.##p##In this meetup we discuss the new era which will bring about the end of jobs, at least as we've known them. What does this mean? Where do we go from here?

28.title: Free Will - Is There Really Such a Thing?
28.intro: Our new format to balance talk time was a success and well received.##p##Join us to discuss the classic topic of free will.##p##The FBI has been successfully using profiling to solve cases for years, and with many new technological advances in the area of predicative social modeling, it would appear it may be becoming increasingly difficult to show where exactly free will is occurring, if at all.

27.title: Domestic Terrorism - Making a Positive Change
27.intro: Becoming a victim of terrorism linked to Muslim Extremism has a very low statistical chance of occurring in your lifetime as an American citizen. Domestic Terrorism on the other hand, has a much higher chance of happening. Without creating a modern day version of "duck and cover" how might we understand the phenomenon, reduce it, and avoid being a victim in our lifetimes.##p##This discussion will open with a creative presentation followed by a brand new format for our live discussion.

26.title: Money - Part II - How it should and can work for us all
26.intro: This is a continuation of our facinating discussion last week on money and the monetary system. In this follow up we will be discussing ways the system can be better and how we can make the system better. As well as how to make money work for ourselves to better our lives.

25.title: Money - How it works and how it should work
25.intro: Money is a massive factor in all of lives, and to a very large extent determines our freedoms and our access to a majority of life has to offer. Poverty is an island void of opportunity. Much of this is due to how money works.

24.title: Technology Philanthropy II
24.intro: Part II of our series on Technical Philanthropy

23.title: Technology Philanthropy I
23.intro: Nothing has a larger effect on our intellect as culture. Culture defines a large amount of who we are, how we think and live. Technology is currently the largest influence on culture. So who ensures technology is being driven in the right direction? Is there a way to know what the right direction is? How should technology be regulated, or should it be?##p##This introduction to Technology Philanthropy hopes to at least begin to look at these important questions.

21.title: The Conspiracy of Conspiracy Theories
21.intro: Conspiracy Theories from government poisoning the skies, to Hillary Clinton being a lesbian pedophile, to secret ancient knowledge, to extra terrestrials living among us, there is a conspiracy theory for any interest. Why?##p##Maybe the best way to navigate the endless seas of conspiracy theories, perhaps we can turn to a conspiracy.

20.title: Homosexuality - Contempary Science & Social Issues
20.intro: Human Sexuality has been a much more prevalent topic in today's society, and so called LGBTQ social issues have become a increasingly common topic.##p##We are going to discuss the science of homosexuality, complementary social issues, and some more abstract thoughts on the topic.

19.title: Disaster Recovery - Who Really Benefits?
19.intro: When major disasters strike the country, emergency support and money comes flooding in. Who really pays for it, how does it really work? Can we do better?

18.title: After Charlottesville - Ending Racism in America
18.intro: Race continues to play a pivotal role in American Society. We are going to discuss what it is going to take to finally end racism in America, if possible.

17.title: How to be a better person
17.intro: Imagine a simple guidebook guided by rational ethics created by a group of people with the intention to improve their lives, and perhaps the lives of others. We begin creating this in our meeting "How to be a better person."##p##Please join us.##p##There will be a digital component to this available to the public and online. Information on how to contribute will be announced a couple days before this meetup.

16.title: Empathy - What is it and how it influences behavior
16.intro: 1 :  the imaginative projection of a subjective state into an object so that the object appears to be infused with it##p##2 :  the action of understanding, being aware of, being sensitive to, and vicariously experiencing the feelings, thoughts, and experience of another of either the past or present without having the feelings, thoughts, and experience fully communicated in an objectively explicit manner; also :  the capacity for this.

15.title: Gun Control & Gun Rights in the USA 2017
15.intro: We'll be discussing gun control in the United States, where things stand in 2017, where things are heading looking into the future.

14.title: Capital Punishment
14.intro: Capital Punishment seems to have been an aspect of human society as far back as the eye of history can see. Is it going away, should it go away, what are the alternatives, and what are the implications.

13.title: Tech Talk - Tips & Tricks on using modern technology
13.intro: This is our first meetup focused on sharing knowledge and skills. I expect everyone attending to learn a bunch of new things about using various technologies. I expect this to be very useful information for everyone attending as well as a whole lot of fun.

12.title: Technology - Are we using it for our own, and the greater good?
12.intro: This will be a hands on interactive meeting so please bring your laptop or tablet if you have one.

11.title: Default Choice - What We Get When We Don't Choose
11.intro: This week we discuss the many choices made on our behalf, what effect this has on our lives, and how this is likely to only increase in the future as society moves in a direction of increased complexity and technology moves forward very rapidly.

10.title: Cultural Influence - How it Shapes Us
10.intro: Culture is likely the most dominate force that shapes our behavior, opinions, and our lives in general. At this meetup we will discuss the pros and cons of our culture and the culture of others and the effects culture has on us all.

9.title: Applying Intelligence - Progression Toward Action
9.intro: Great time for newcomers. We are going to recap what we've discussed so far, and brainstorm how we as a group may be able to reach the stated objective for this meetup - Applying intelligence to conscientiously improve ourselves and our communities.

8.title: Rational Ethics - Empirically Determined Morality and Ethics
8.intro: This meetup we are going to try to formulate concrete ideas regarding morality and ethics, how we may be able to measure and quantify them, and where we may be able to go from there.

7.title: Critical Thinking in 2017
7.intro: This is a look at Classic Critical Thinking skills and how we may or may not best apply this to contemporary society with a particular focus on the internet and misinformation.

6.title: God the Creator - A Possible Case for Theology
6.intro: Kris Tyte will present a case for a possible modern version of theology. This will at a minimum be interesting.

5.title: Artificial Intelligence - In Our Own Image!
5.intro: Artificial Intelligence - An abstract look at what is AI is, where it may be headed, and its possible implications.

4.title: Manipulation Protection
4.intro: Shield yourself from the tricks used by marketing and advertising by learning the tactics they use to manipulate us (simple, complex, and what might be coming).

3.title: Nutritional Morality
3.intro: Should food be a globally protected domain and access to proper nutrition be a global basic human right?

2.title: The Benefit of Finite Power
2.intro: Human cognitive limitation at first glance seems like a difficult human barrier. Perhaps it can be looked at as one of our largest strengths.

1.title: Intelligence and Morality
1.intro: Does morality in general increase with intelligence? Are intelligent people more likely to be highly moral?
